Label: attack-mitigation-in-progress
Description: Attack mitigation setup is in progress (e.g., changing the network path to redirect the inbound traffic to a DOTS mitigator).

Label: attack-successfully-mitigated
Description: Attack is being successfully mitigated (e.g., traffic is redirected to a DDoS mitigator and attack traffic is dropped).

Label: attack-stopped
Description: Attack has stopped and the DOTS client can withdraw the mitigation request.

Label: attack-exceeded-capability
Description: Attack has exceeded the mitigation provider capability.

Label: dots-client-withdrawn-mitigation
Description: DOTS client has withdrawn the mitigation request and the mitigation is active but terminating.

Label: attack-mitigation-signal-loss
Description: Attack mitigation will be triggered for the mitigation request only when the DOTS signal channel session is lost.
